intro: Stenogyne kukuiensis, commonly known as the Kukui tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. The Kukui tree plays an important role in Hawaiian culture and ecology.
